content.description: Sit start on extremely thin fingertips of the finger crack just left of the arete between the left and center face. The crack gets wider towards the top.
content.location: It is on the arete between the left and center face.

content.description: Work your way up the decent slab just right of Satan Right using solid holds on the arete and good features for your feet.
content.location: This is the small slab right of the Satan Face.

content.description: Start both hands on the center flake. Dyno up and right to a good pocket with your right hand. Lace your left hand into the good pocket, go for a good, right undercling just below the arete, bring your left hand to a decent knob, and pull up and over.
content.protection: Pads and a good spotter. There is a tree stump and a few good rocks to look out for.
content.location: This is of opposite side of the block from the highway. The starting holds are right where it says "BEWARE".

content.description: Start on the chalky block in the center of the overhanging face. Make a big move to crimp ledge 5 feet up and left of the block. Match on the rail, and move your feet up and left. Slap at the slopey lip, match, and make it work! The crux is the topout.

Sit start on underclings 5 feet directly below big block in center of overhanging face. Make a big move to a block, match, and continue up Satan Center. This gets you tired enough to make the rest a tad harder.

Start with both hands on the center hold on the Satan Face. Dyno up and right to the same good pocket of Satan Right. Move your left hand straight up to the crescent crimp on the lip. Figure out the top out for yourself.
content.location: This lies in the center of the Satan Face.

content.description: Sit start with both hands on the hand crack under the mini-roof. Follow the crack up and right and go straight up between the mini-roof and large shelf to the right.
content.location: The is on left face of the 128 Block if you're looking at it from the highway. Also it is just right of the Satan Slab.

content.description: Pull up onto the incut crimps on the prow and dyno to the arete with your right hand. The crux is sticking the openhanded pinch on the high arete.
content.location: This climbs the left arete on the overhanging Satan's face.

content.description: Start with both hands matched on a good hold and crummy feet, move left and throw to the big shelf, pull up, and top out.
content.location: This is in the middle of the left side face looking at the block from the highway. It is also in the middle of the walkoff of the block.

content.description: Start sitting on underclings directly underneath the plate/jug for Satan's. Pull up and traverse right on the low small crimps. End on the right, bulging arete.
content.location: Start low on underclings in the middle of the overhanging Satan's face.

content.description: Sit start under the mini roof on the hand crack, move up and right till you reach a good finger look reach up and around the roof for a good jug. Move up and slong the arete to the top.
content.location: This climbs the back left corner looking from the highway.

content.description: Sit start with thin crimps of each side of the arete. Undercling the fang looking jug, and move your right hand up for a good ledge. Pull up, move right to an okay rail, and top out.
content.location: This is on the prow between the right hand face and the Satan Face.

content.description: With both hands matched of a solid hold, paste your feet on the wall and throw yourself to a good lip about 5 feet up.
content.location: This is on the right hand face looking at the block from the highway.

content.description: Do the same start as Center. After gaining the ledge, move right to sloper, and get around the corner.
content.location: Use the same start as Center.

content.description: Sit start with hands on a good edge with okay feet. Move up to the left-leaning edge which thins out before topping out on good jugs.
content.location: This starts right in the middle of the center face looking at the block from the highway. It's normally pretty well-chalked and is hard to miss.

content.description: Start the same as One Move Wonder, but move up and right to a good horn looking hold. Move your feet up, bump up to the large shelf, and top out.
content.location: This is in the middle of the left hand face under the walkoff.

content.description:
This is one of my favorite blocks on Cape Ann. There is a little bit of everything here and all just feet from your car. The 128 Boulder also most likely has the highest density of problems for anyone boulder on Cape Ann. 

  This is the home of Satan and his awesome problems. Be warned though, if playing with Satan, you'll need a few pads and good spotters.
